net.fathomsoft.nova.util

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.util.Location

  • public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains information for a line number and character offset. Used in the compilation process, in the event that there is an error or warning, for knowing where exactly it occurred in the source code.
    Since:
    v0.1 Jan 7, 2014 at 10:11:40 AM
    Version:
    v0.2.20 Jul 29, 2014 at 7:26:50 PM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

      • Location

        public Location()
        Default constructor.

      • Location

        public Location(Location loc)
        Copy the location data from the given Location variable into a newly instantiated Location instance.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to copy the data from.

      • Location

        public Location(int lineNumber,
                int offset,
                int start,
                int end)
        Constructor that initializes the lineNumber and offset to the given values.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - The lineNumber that the Location represents.
        offset - The character offset horizontally on the current line.
        start - The character offset that the Location represents as the start throughout the whole source text.
        end - The character offset that the Location represents as the end throughout the whole source text.

      • setOffset

        public void setOffset(int offset)
        Set character offset that the Location represents on the specified line number.
        Parameters:
        offset - The character offset that the Location represents on the specified line number.

      • addOffset

        public void addOffset(int amount)
        Add the given amount to each of the Location's offset value.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setOffset(bounds.getOffset() + amount);
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to add to the Location's offset.

      • subtractOffset

        public void subtractOffset(int amount)
        Subtract the given amount from each of the Location's offset value.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setOffset(bounds.getOffset() - amount);
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to subtract from the Location's offset.

      • getBounds

        public Bounds getBounds()
        Get the Bounds of the Location's offset. The starting and ending offsets.
        Returns:
        The Bounds instance containing the starting and ending offsets.

      • setBounds

        public void setBounds(int start,
                      int end)
        Set the character bound offsets on the specified Location's line number.
        Parameters:
        start - The character offset that the Location represents as the start on the specified line.
        end - The character offset that the Location represents as the end on the specified line.

      • addBounds

        public void addBounds(int amount)
        Add the given amount to each of the Bounds's start and end values.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setStart(bounds.getStart() + amount);
 bounds.setEnd(bounds.getEnd() + amount);
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to add to the Bounds's values.

      • moveBounds

        public void moveBounds(int startAmount,
                       int endAmount)
        Add the given amounts to each of the Bounds's start and end values.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setStart(bounds.getStart() + startAmount);
 bounds.setEnd(bounds.getEnd() + endAmount);
        Parameters:
        startAmount - The amount to add to the Bounds's start value.
        endAmount - The amount to add to the Bounds's end value.

      • subtractBounds

        public void subtractBounds(int startAmount,
                           int endAmount)
        Subtract the given amounts to each of the Bounds's start and end values.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setStart(bounds.getStart() - startAmount);
 bounds.setEnd(bounds.getEnd() - endAmount);
        Parameters:
        startAmount - The amount to subtract to the Bounds's start value.
        endAmount - The amount to subtract to the Bounds's end value.

      • subtractBounds

        public void subtractBounds(int amount)
        Subtract the given amount from each of the Bounds's start and end values.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setStart(bounds.getStart() - amount);
 bounds.setEnd(bounds.getEnd() - amount);
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to subtract from the Bounds's values.

      • addBounds

        public void addBounds(int startAmount,
                      int endAmount)
        Add the given amounts to each of the Bounds's start and end values.

        This is the same as calling the following: 
         bounds.setStart(bounds.getStart() + startAmount);
 bounds.setEnd(bounds.getStart() + endAmount);
        Parameters:
        startAmount - The amount to add as the Bounds's start value.
        endAmount - The amount to add as the Bounds's end value.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Get whether the line number is a valid location in a source file, or just generated.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the Location is valid in the source file.

      • asNew

        public Location asNew()
        Create a new Location that reflects the specified parent Location.
        Returns:
        A new Location reflecting the specified parent Location.
